title: What are some good books to read about exploration? - Quora

response.answer_text: I have three to suggest, all non-fiction.  This is the riveting tale of an English pirate and explorer who died in 1715. He influenced Charles Darwin with his observations about nature, and Daniel Defoe also used a story of his as an inspiration for Robinson Crusoe. He was the first captain to circumnavigate the globe three times. In addition, he first used 80 then-novel words (such as “barbecue” and “avocado”) in print.  This much-heralded account of Ernest Shackleton's 1914–1915 expedition across Antartica is a classic telling, long and yet still hard to put down. The Endurance, Shackleton’s ship, becomes locked in ice. The privations of the crew (and Shackleton himself) make for a tense story that shows what true, caring leadership can be during the darkest of times. This book belongs on the shelf of anyone who loves exploration.  If you want a quicker read that will keep you on the edge of your seat, read The Land of Z about Percy Fawcett’s 1925 exploration of the Amazon. Over the Edge of the World: Magellan's Terrifying Circumnavigation of the Globe by Laurence Bergreen (2003) Endurance: Shackleton's Incredible Voyage by Alfred Lansing (1959) In the Kingdom of Ice: The Grand and Terrible Polar Voyage of the USS Jeannette by Hampton Sides (2014)    River of Darkness: Francisco Orellana's Legendary Voyage of Death and Discovery Down the Amazon by Buddy Levy (2011) The Lost City of Z: A Tale of Deadly Obsession in the Amazon by David Grann (2009) The Journals of Lewis and Clark by Meriwether Lewis (1905)
